Based on the user's preferences and the content of the recommended movies, I would suggest 'Zero Dark Thirty' to the user.
'S Zero Dark Thirty' is a 2012 American political thriller film directed by Kathryn Bigelow, based on the non-fiction book "The New York Times Book of reporting on terrorism" written by Mark Mazzetti, with screenplays written by Bigelow and Alex Kurtz. The movie stars Jennifer Lawrence as Maya Jones, a CIA agent who goes rogue after she is ordered to track down Osama bin Laden, the leader of al-Qaeda. The movie also stars Josh Brolin as Richard Bauer, the director of the CIA's Counter-Terrorism Center at Fort Meade in Maryland.

Based on the user's preferences, I recommend "Red Cliff" as a compelling historical drama.

The movie is set during the Three Kingdoms period of China (220-280 AD). The main characters are Sun Quan, Liu Bei, and Zhuge Liang. The story revolves around their attempts to unite China under one banner.

The movie features an impressive cast including Tony Chiu Wai Leung as Sun Quan, Takeshi Kaneshiro as Liu Bei, and Takeshi Kaneshiro as Zhuge Liang. Other notable actors in the movie include Shu Qi as Guo Ji, Liang Jie as Pan Lingzhu, and Zhao Lei as Xue Qiu.

The movie features a stunning visual effects (VFX) production team led by director Zhang Yim. The VFX team includes several talented VFX artists such as Hong Kong-based VFX artist Wang Xiaobin who worked on the movie's VFX production design.
基于这些 preference, I recommend "Red Cliff"
